oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 02 e
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 02 e. Newspaper clipping: 'In speaking of Mrs. l.C. French...'
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Scrapbooks; Clippings; Women;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In speaking of Mrs. L. C. French, who is now in Chattanooga, the Chattanooga News says: "Mrs. Lizzie Crozier French is a frequent and welcome visitor in this city. She is known throughout Tennessee and the south as a woman who is pro- gressive in the truest sense' of that term, whose mind, heart and soul reflect only that which is good and reject all that is evil. Educated to a high degree, possessing rare refinement, she unites personal magnetism and love of humanity to such an extent that she is equally approachable to the lowest and the high est. The proudest women in Tennesse claim her as their personal friend. She is the founder of Ossoli Circle, Knoxville, the first federated club in the south.
